description: A high-powered military weapon has been stolen and lost at a towering mountain peak and it's up to a u.s. team of expert climbers and military personnel to reach it before the Russian terrorists do.
keywords: snow adventure,president,the white house washington d.c.,satellite,mountain climber
name: Sub Zero

review.name: Almost entertaining, in a burning orphanage sort of way.
review.reviewBody: This is worth seeing, if only to provide a floor for rating all other movies. Worst of all time? Probably not. laughingly, shockingly horrible? Definitely. I was embarrassed for the actors in the movie, who must have been randomly recruited from a Greyhound terminal. I was also embarrassed for the movie Vertical Limit, which, though it is also a terrible movie in it's own right, actually made an effort, and has some entertainment value including a couple of Point Break-esquire one-liners. Sub Zero lifted almost all of it's action sequences and mountain scenes from Vertical Limit. When I say lifted, I don't mean they borrowed ideas, but rather cut-and-pasted footage. Another person wrote that one scene looked like an SNL skit, and I agree. Sub Zero is so pathetic, it is almost entertaining. But not quite.

trailer.description: Home Video Trailer from Lionsgate Home Entertainment
trailer.name: Sub Zero
